resources:
Speech Master About Exit Beginner Intermediate Advanced
Master English Pronunciation Say something.
Sorry! Your device doesn't support speech input.
More Press speak and say this... Sounds like you said...
Hello. 
 /həlo/ My name is 
 /maj nem ɪz/ How are you? 
 /haw ɑr ju/ Do you speak English? 
 /du ju spik ɪŋglɪʃ/ I don't speak English. 
 /aj dont spik ɪŋglɪʃ/ Thank you. 
 /θæŋk ju/ You're welcome. 
 /jʊr wɛlkəm/ I come from 
 /aj kəm frəm/ yes 
 /jɛs/ no 
 /no/ maybe 
 /mebi/ perhaps 
 /pərhæps/ Thanks. 
 /θæŋks/ Thank you very much. 
 /θæŋk ju vɛri mətʃ/ Please speak slowly. 
 /pliz spik sloli/ I don't speak much English. 
 /aj dont spik mətʃ ɪŋglɪʃ/ I don't understand much English.
 /aj dont əndərstænd mətʃ ɪŋglɪʃ/ I understand. 
 /aj əndərstænd/ I don't understand. 
 /aj dont əndərstænd/ Where is the bathroom? 
 /wɛr ɪz ðə bæθrum/ Where is the toilet? 
 /wɛr ɪz ðə tɔjlət/ I speak a little English. 
 /aj spik ə lɪtəl ɪŋglɪʃ/ Don't mention it. 
 /dont mɛnʃən ɪt/ Hi. 
 /haj/ Good morning. 
 /gʊd mɔrnɪŋ/ Good evening. 
 /gʊd ivnɪŋ/ Good afternoon. 
 /gʊd æftərnun/ Excuse me. 
 /ɪkskjus mi/ Bye. 
 baj// Good bye. 
 /gʊd baj/ Good night. 
 /gʊd najt/ See you. 
 /si ju/ See you later. 
 /si ju letər/ See you soon. 
 /si ju sun/ What time is it? 
 /wət tajm ɪz ɪt/ Sorry. 
 /sɑri/ No problem. 
 /no prɑbləm/ It's okay. 
 /ɪts oke/ That's okay. 
 /thats oke/ One. 
 /wən/ Two. 
 /tu/ Three. 
 /θri/ Four. 
 /fɔr/ Five. 
 /fajv/ Six. 
 /sɪks/ Seven. 
 /sɛvən/ Eight. 
 /et/ Nine. 
 /najn/ Ten. 
 /tɛn/ Have a nice day. 
 /hæv ə najs de/
Where can I find the bank? Do you know where the bathroom is? Where is the supermarket? Can you tell me where the bus stop is? I don't really speak a lot of English. Thank you for your time.111 It's been my pleasure. That's all for now. Thank you.
This should be a fairly advanced sentence. What time does the train arrive at the station? Is there any place we can get a bit to eat? As far as I know, there aren't any good restaurants around here. I can speak English without many problems. Where should we look for our classmates later? Never mind. We're just trying to find our friends for dinner. There are a lot of things we can do. What do you suggest?
